channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AZ
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AZ

item.title: Report X-2024030732
item.description:
Report X-2024030732

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-22T18:13:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-08
  • City: TEMPE
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found leaking during the loading phase, QA was notified and package was placed into a lined HazMat tote with orientation labels up. DescribePack: Loose caps caused the inner container to leak and damage the outer container. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a lined HazMat tote with orientation labels up to prevent further leaks.

item.title: Report X-2024030611
item.description:
Report X-2024030611

  • City: PHOENIX

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: ABF stated as they were breaking the trailer and noticed the carton was wet and noticed what was on the trailer floor had been there for a while. ABF thinks this was punctured when being loaded at 165/SNB. The spill is contained in the trailer and Cura is being called for dispatch.

item.title: Report X-2024030539
item.description:
Report X-2024030539

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-07
  • City: GOODYEAR
  • State: AZ

  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER RECEIVED A CALL FOR A LEAKING PACKAGE IN THE UNLOAD WALL. UPON ARRIVAL RESPONDER IDENTIFIED SAID LEAKING PACKAGE, PLACED SAID PACKAGE IN SPILL TRAY FOR TRANSPORT, AND TRANSPORTED TO DMP AREA FOR PROPER DISPOSAL.

item.title: Report X-2024030475
item.description:
Report X-2024030475

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-06
  • City: TUCSON
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered inside a trailer with no visible damage on the first flap leaking out of the bottom. DescribePack: 1.5-inch crack on the bottom left corner of the frontside of plastic bottle. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package was places in a bag inside a red storage plastic container.

item.title: Report X-2024030253
item.description:
Report X-2024030253

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-18T15:10:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-03
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: package was sent through the overhead sorters where the top of one of the bottles became loose and started to leak. The package was placed in a hazmat bag lined tote and brought to the QA area for processing. DescribePack: One of the bottle tops came loose and leaked. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in the upright position and the bottle top was tightened down

item.title: Report X-2024030255
item.description:
Report X-2024030255

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-18T15:10:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-03
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was coming from the unload area when it was noticed that the bottom of the box was wet. The lids of two bottles came loose during the shipping process causing the bottles to leak. DescribePack: The tops of 2 bottles leaked DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The bottle tops were tightened down

item.title: Report X-2024030254
item.description:
Report X-2024030254

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-18T15:10:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-03
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: package was being unloaded when it toppled off the rollers and onto the dock upside down causing one of the tops to completely come off the plastic bottle and all of the liquid spilled out. The top may have become loose during the shipping process. DescribePack: One bottle top came off DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The wet package was placed in a hazmat bag lined tote and brought to the QA area for processing.

item.title: Report X-2024030256
item.description:
Report X-2024030256

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-18T15:10:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-03
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE CAME TOO QA IN A HAZMAT LINED TOTE. IT WAS SECURED USING PROPER PPE TOLLS AND ATTIRE. DescribePack: THE PACKAGE WAS CRACKED ON BOTTOM OF THE PLASTIC BUCKET AND LEAKING SMALL AMOUNTS OUT. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: WHEN PACKAGE WAS NOTICE PACKAGE WAS PUT INSIDE A HAZMAT LINED TOTE TO STOP THE SPILLAGE.

item.title: Report X-2024030686
item.description:
Report X-2024030686

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-22T18:13:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-27
  • City: GOODYEAR
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: From what we know either the spill occurred and the HESS wasn't complete or the hazmat wasn't shipped as the weight on the label is informing us. DescribePack: I wasn't able to find any holes and or punctures on the steel drum. DurationRel: 2000 and MitigateEffect: I don't know what to mitigate when their appears to be no sign of any contents in the drum.

item.title: Report X-2024021918
item.description:
Report X-2024021918

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-21T15:13:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-22
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: BNSF Mechanical identified a possible release from top of car while switching. Graymar Env was mobilized to inspect and identified two man way swing bolts requiring 4 full rotations to secure. Shipper notified once release was confirmed. Release has been secured for continued movement.
